hero.title: Happy Children - Dental Treatment with Love and Patience
hero.subtitle: At Dr. Lena Zembel's clinic, we don't just treat teeth - we build confidence, peace of mind, and positive experiences for children and parents.

whyUs.title: Why Children (and Parents) Love Coming to Us?

items.title: No Pressure
items.description: The first visit always starts with a conversation, not treatment. We create a pleasant and relaxed visit experience.

items.title: Age-Appropriate Approach
items.description: Eye-level explanations, without stressful words. Using adapted developmental language.

items.title: Positive Distractions
items.description: Screen with favorite videos, toys, stickers, and also the option to bring a toy from home.

items.title: Parents as Partners
items.description: One parent always stays with the child - and even participates if desired. Parents are an important part of the process.

expertise.title: Expertise in Child Treatment
expertise.description: Our clinic team undergoes special training in treating children and is in constant contact with leading experts in pediatric dentistry. We believe that your child's first experience with a dentist can affect their attitude towards oral and dental health for life.

steps.title: Welcome with a Toy
steps.description: We'll start with a meeting in the playroom

steps.title: Brief Explanation at the Children's Station
steps.description: We'll show dental equipment and toys

steps.title: Brushing Together in Front of a Mirror
steps.description: We'll learn the correct brushing technique

steps.title: Gentle Scanning with a Small Camera
steps.description: We'll count teeth with a camera

steps.title: Personal Prize at the End
steps.description: Choosing a sticker or small surprise

footer.note: No treatments during the first visit unless there is an immediate medical need

items.question: At what age should dental treatments begin?
items.answer: Usually recommended around two and a half years old - or after the eruption of the first teeth. An early visit helps accustom the child to the clinic environment and build a positive experience from the start.

items.question: What if the child doesn't cooperate?
items.answer: That's perfectly fine - we have gentle methods based on a psychological approach for children. We adapt the treatment to the child's pace, and sometimes start with just a brief introduction and play during the first visit.

items.question: Can we come just for consultation?
items.answer: Certainly. There is no commitment to continue treatment. An initial consultation is a good opportunity to ask questions, meet the team, and see if the clinic suits you and your child.

items.question: How do I prepare my child for the first visit?
items.answer: It's recommended to discuss the visit with the child in a positive and light way, emphasizing that it's a visit to meet the dentist and count teeth. Avoid frightening terms or stories of negative experiences.

items.question: Can parents be present during treatment?
items.answer: Of course. We encourage parental presence in the treatment room, especially with young children. However, sometimes older children cooperate better when they enter alone.
